DOC.brief_summary: Study determine safety , tolerability pharmacokinetics BILR 355 BS plus low dose ritonavir healthy male volunteer .
DOC.brief_title: Dose Escalation Study Safety , Tolerability Pharmacokinetics BILR 355 BS Plus Low Dose Ritonavir HIV-uninfected Male Volunteers
DOC.criteria: 1 . Males meet follow criterion : Based upon complete medical history , include physical examination , vital sign ( BP , PR ) , 12lead ECG , clinical laboratory test No find deviate normal ( except note ) clinical relevance No evidence clinically relevant concomitant disease 2 . Age ≥18 year < 60 3 . BMI ≥18.5 BMI ≤29.9 kg/m2 ( Body Mass Index ) 4 . Signed date write informed consent prior admission study accordance Good Clinical Practice local legislation 1 . Current medically relevant gastrointestinal , hepatic , renal , respiratory , cardiovascular , metabolic , immunological hormonal disorder 2 . Surgery gastrointestinal tract ( except appendectomy ) 3 . Diseases central nervous system ( epilepsy ) psychiatric disorder neurological disorder 4 . History relevant orthostatic hypotension , faint spell blackouts 5 . Chronic relevant acute infection 6 . History allergy/hypersensitivity ( include drug allergy ) deem relevant trial judge investigator 7 . Intake drug long halflife ( > 24 hour ) within one month prior administration study drug trial 8 . Use drug within 10 day prior administration trial , might reasonably influence result trial base knowledge time protocol preparation 9 . Participation another trial investigational drug within one month prior administration trial 10 . Smoker 11 . Inability refrain smoke trial day 12 . Alcohol abuse ( 60 g/day ) 13 . Drug abuse 14 . Recent blood donation ( 100 mL within 4 week prior administration trial ) 15 . Excessive physical activity ( within 1 week prior administration trial ) 16 . Any laboratory value outside normal reference range clinical relevance 17 . Inability comply dietary regimen study centre 18 . Infected hepatitis B hepatitis C virus ( define either hepatitis B surface antigen , hepatitis B core antibody , hepatitis C antibody positive ) 19 . HIV1 infect define positive HIV ELISA test
